content.description: Really fun route with a decent sized slab to start. Bolts were recently placed as of July 2021. Rock is all granite. Lots of lichen and pretty rough on the hands.
content.protection: Bolts, anchors at top (as of July 2021)
content.location: Park off of Conesca Rd in the small parking lot. Follow the trail for about 50 or so feet until you see the small approach trail off to the left. You will pass some boulders (I didn't try them but i'm sure someone could project them.) Continue past these and up until you reach the face.

content.description: Solid route with a large arete to work around.
content.location: Park in the small parking area on the left side of Conesca Rd. From there, follow the small trail about 50 or so feet, to the left there is an unmarked approach trail. Takes about 5-10 minutes to get to the crag.

content.description: Solid route with good hardware. Lots of lichen and some really fresh granite.
content.location: Park in the small parking area on the left side of Conseca Rd. From there, follow the trail about 50 ft or so. On the left there is an unmarked approach trail that leads directly up to the crag.

content.description: A privately maintained public trail leads around and up to the top of Mount Pismire. Good hardware was placed recently with some anchor bolts at the top. (As of July 2021)
